title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, mostly asked why I would stay in the role, and how I would keep a customer happy when a manager couldn’t be reached, and if I would be happy starting at 12.00 and hour
Interview Questions: Why would a person as qualified as you stay in this role for an extended period of time

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: It was a helpful process that gave information about the position dn the work environment. I was able to connect with he program director and the research lead. I enjoyed the interview and would have pursued the position further if ti were aligned with my career goals.
Interview Questions: What are your skills that relate to the job

title: Education Curator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was quick to respond with updates. The interview was a panel filled with all staff from the department. Interview was pleasant, informative and very comfortable. Each staff asked a series of questions.
Interview Questions: What unique skills would you bring that would benefit the department.

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS)
Interview Descriptions: the process was longer than a normal interview process, but worth it in the end, if you get the job. The school works with your classes and makes it very easy to handle school and a job at the same time.
Interview Questions: a few of the questions you are given hypothetical situations and asked how you would go about solving them.

title: Accessibility Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and easy. Phase 1 was a video-chat panel style interview. Questions were asked in a  round-robin format. Phase 2 included an in person demonstration of how to conduct a training.
Interview Questions: What are three words that describe you?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Self-introduction.
20-min presentation to talk about your Ph.D. and explain how the skills you have in your Ph.D. can support the freshman year teaching and how to balance teaching and research.
Question and answer session.
Interview Questions:
Why choose this university?
How to prepare new lessons?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: It was more of a direct-hire. The recruiting was evaluated based on past experience with the university which was good.  It was a 10 -15-minute interview and basic knowledge of materials and mechanical properties were required.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: A brief meeting with the at-the-time Department chair and my would-be Academic advisor. We met in person, and had a fairly casual discussion about what the hiring process was like at the University.
Interview Questions: What is your field of research?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: This was absolutely the most unprofessional interview experience. I came from a different state. The travel arrangements were a mess. They couldn't provide the room at the hotel on campus like originally stated. They couldn't provide transport to and from the airport like originally stated. This resulted in having to make a lot of these arrangements myself at the last minute. There were interviews with two committees and then a presentation. None of the people could show up on time for the interviews.
Interview Questions: What is a time that you have faced an ethical dilemma for a job and how did you handle it?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: easy but  do your research on the university before you go, just need to  know some information about broad topics,  sort of a scattered interview process, I got the impression that they just really, really needed to hire someone asap
Interview Questions: What would you do if a prospective student asked you about the university mascot?

title: Instructional Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds interview with multiple interviewers. The first one was phone interview, and the second one was on campus interview that took a full day. I was asked delivering a 15 mins presentation, then had a lunch with the team at the local restaurant. Then, I had a campus tour with the team supervisor.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position...

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an interview fair to interview with different offices hiring for select graduate degrees, but some were open to any degree. I had one round and then a follow up phone interview and then was offered the positon.
Interview Questions: What will you find difficult?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Poorly organized interview. Half of the faculty members didnt show up and one member of the search committee also didnt show up and no one knew why he was absent.
The university overall is really behind everyone else and it felts like I went back in time to the 1800`s. It felt really boring to be on campus. The university is located in a small town that is very rural and isolated. The town itself has nothing to offer and the houses are pretty old as it is in any old southern town. If you like to be in a quiet place with no intellectual stimulation and low salaries, then you may not mind these "living conditions".
I feel lucky that I was able to hear few opinions from faculty I met, who talked about different social issues that faculty usually are expected to be more progressive such as abortion, and gun violence issues. If you think that this is fine, then this place is for you. For me, the level of ignorance and backwardness sent me running for the hills.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Assistant Athletic Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I could tell that the interviewers cared about how I would fit in, were very descriptive about the challenges of the position, and it was a hard room to read. Questions could be tough and there was little follow-up to know if you were giving an answer they preferred.
Interview Questions: What about your career prepares you to be successful in this role specifically?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is a form virtual interview with a panel group. There were 5 people in the room. Each of them asked different questions. It was friendly and positive experience.
Interview Questions: What is the first thing you see when you review an online course.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: They called by phone and asked about my background and what I can help. They asked if I need initial fund. They said I will have student from other departments as well
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you had a problem

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It took long time between interviews but it was generally good everything seems ok till the end, i’d prefer they tell me a reason for not getting  an offer
Interview Questions: Technical and classic behavioral questions

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by more than one member of the department. I was asked general interview questions, which were open ended and left room for discussion. The interview itself lasted 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your weakest quality?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: you apply via online portal of respective department. if you meet qualifications they will give you position. maintaining  3.0 GPA is must. If you maintain higher GPA than 3.0 its great as it gives you benefit in  next terms selection process
Interview Questions: What experience you have with Matlab or java?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Short thirty minute screening interview by video followed by an in-person interview with the search committee, faculty, staff, and students. The in-person interview included several meetings with various groups. I received follow up communication after the interview within two weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience in this area.

title: Intramural Official Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I think the job interview process was wonderful. I think that the process helped me grow as an individual and get professional interview experience. It was very helpful even though the questions were challenging
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Walked in and asked for a job application. Everything was pretty standard and the people were very easy to talk to & polite. Did a presentation of my portfolio and the honest feedback given was really helpful too.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: They ask a few questions about your previous work experience. They ask questions about personality. They ask questions about what you would do if something happens. Then the boss emailed me when I could start working. Then I sent her my classes schedule and she had me working according to my classes schedule
Interview Questions: Have you had any other job before

title: Rec Official Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lare group interview than one on one. They try to make it a bigger deal but it is not that hard for a part-time college job. The managers think campus rec is the biggest thing in the world.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join campus rec

title: Conference Housing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and interviewed in person.  Online application was streamlined and easy to fill out and interview was light-hearted and easy. The turn back time for a response was immediate. (1 week from interview date).
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you?

title: Community Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you filed out an application online. Then they called you and asked you like 7 questions.  The questions were relatively easy. If you could work a lot of hours you got the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone came to the desk angry?

title: Fitness Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview in first round. Current employees interview you.  The next step is an individual interview w/ manager in the second round. They grade your interview on cover letter, resume, and interview answers.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had such good credentials going in, that my interview was just when I could start. I was more nervous going into the interview than I needed to be and that was great!
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Competive some what disorganized, it helps to know people when interviewing they for sure have some level of nepotism in the intern departments, I feel I was chosen however based on my qualifications as I did not know anyone
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the position?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Informal.  I simply spoke to chairman.   He simply wanted to know my abilities. I told him I taught in the past. I simply had to be patient.   I didn't know that I would be teaching until the very end.   Overall the process was very smooth. He recommended the textbook that I used.
Interview Questions: Past experience.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I called Earnie Harrison, who is the head of the Technological Services Department, after seeing the post on the Student Employment section on Ole Miss' website. I had an interview two hours after that conversation. Once I went in, Earnie asked me if I was familiar with computer hardware and if I had a driver's license. Next question was when can you start.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with computers and other hardware like printers, fax machines, etc.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. After a few days, I received an email requesting a telephone interview. This was my first interview, so I had no idea what questions to expect. I was not prepared to answer some of their questions and kind of panicked. It was definitely a learning experience and now I know how to answer these questions for future interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had to deal with difficult circumstances.

title: Sports Reporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Maysville, KY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met my boss on Twitter back in 2015 when I was looking for a job while I was living in Kentucky. I told her my situation and I sent her my resume. From there, I had the job coming back home.
Interview Questions: How passionate are you about sports journalism?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called by the department supervisor for an interview approximately two weeks after application was submitted.  Interviewed the next Tuesday with a committee of 7 people.  After the first interview, I was called again on Friday to come back the next Monday and speak with the department supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a mistake that you made and what actions you took to correct it and prevent it from happening again in the future

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not difficult at all. You should answer the questions honestly and specifically. Dress appropriately with just enough personality to show but not too flashy. Speak clearly and articulate in a loud enough voice.
Interview Questions: Would you relinquish a document for a friend ?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by a recruiter and then moved on to phone interview which was followed by in person.    I was not looking for a position but they needed someone who had management experience for a department facing many personnel issues.   The process was not difficult but in the end it was not the right career move for me.
Interview Questions: Why I would consider leaving my current employer,

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with two members of faculty who questioned me regarding my motivation and career goals. It was a pretty laid back process. Nothing too serious.Although i was a bit tense, the interviewing professors were extremely helpful in making me feel relax. That is generally the ole miss attitude. Friendliness, Genial and kind folks
Interview Questions: Why do i want to attend this school

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview was rescheduled at the last minute, but didn't cause me to be too nervous. It was a Pretty intense interview. A lot of application questions were asked, but overall I really enjoyed the process and didn't think it was too challenging.
Interview Questions: What was one of your weaknesses at your previous employer?

title: Intramural Spors Club Official Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The first step was going to the Ole Miss Campus Recreation Job Fair. 
The second step was submitting in person your cover letter and resume
The third step was having a group interview of about 8 students to 2 interviewers.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strengths?

title: Assistant Media Relations Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: They called me, we set up a time around my work schedule. Wore a suit. They showed me around the athletic building and specifically the department that I would be working in. We talked for about 30 minutes and they said to expect an answer in the next 3 days.
Interview Questions: What do you know about sports?

title: Facility Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview consisted of a one-on-one interview. I was asked several interview questions and my responses were evaluated to see if I would really be a great fit for University of Mississippi Campus Recreation. Following I received an email confirming that I was chosen as one of the candidates for one of the open positions.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this job?

title: Financial Aid Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process included an initial application, resume and cover letter submission. The interview process was relaxed and very basic. I was familiar with the staff and that made the interview more comfortable.
Interview Questions: What is your opinion of Financial Aid

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I spent a whole day being interviewed at "Super Saturday." The beginning of the day included group activities and ice breakers.  We were broken into groups and did rotations of all of the activities that were going on.  We did things like plan our perfect dorm, plan programs, etc. The end of the day included individual interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was brought into a room with 3 people, one GCD and two current CA's. I was asked several questions about why I was applying and how I would treat the position and why I felt the job was important. The also used some of these question to try and get a good opinion of my personality. I knew the GCD who interviewed me, so I was probably a bit easier for me than the average applicant.
Interview Questions: How will you contribute to the development of a housing community?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I had to email a description of things I were capable of doing. I also discussed in the email my past work experiences, honors, etc. The next day, I was called for an interview. They asked your common interview questions. It was very easy. It was very laidback, yet professional.
Interview Questions: Every question was easy.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
i was interviewed by my professor who was teaching me circuits. I am electrical engineering student from India. I did not have very good research opportunities before so I was glad I got a chance.
It was a difficult interview as my professor asked me advanced stuff that I had no idea about. I did get the job at the end but I declined it as I had a better n campus job going on. I would say Ole Miss is biased in selecting people for job.
Interview Questions: What qualities you have.

title: Counselor's Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job via email, and got an interview invitation within a few days. However, most of the jobs are through an online application and take quite some time to get a call.  I had a phone interview because I was four hours away.  I had to provide references, then I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Questions were fairly basic.

title: Radio DJ Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two students with zits reviewed my qualifications. They asked things like "do you like, um, music?" To which I would reply "yes." They asked me what kind of music I like and I answered offering up my favorite two bands as a response. They were impressed and I got the job.
Interview Questions: What is your name?

title: Regional Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi
Interview Descriptions: I received a call asking me to interview for this position. The interview involved a one on one meeting with the director, with the Assistant Vice Chancellor, and then a group interview. Questions are very typical, asking you to sell the school, etc: all things you would expect from someone who is recruiting. No questions about your resume really. It's like they all have a script and go around the room alternating. Hiring process was somewhat unprofessional, due to a lack of strong communication between the department and HR. Should have tipped me off to the office culture.
Interview Questions: Sell Ole Miss in one minute.

title: Regional Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the HR website and received a phone call about a week later to come in for an interview. The interview process was 3 parts: a 4 person panel, one on one with the Director, and one on one with a Vice Chancellor. The panel part was all situational questions; what would you do if a student/parent asked/told you this? There was a script that they stuck to, bouncing around the room each asking different questions. They only asked one general question about what experience I had that I felt qualified me for the position. The one on one with the Director was more for me to ask specific questions about the position and the one on one with the Vice Chancellor is her stressing the importance of always acting professional in the position.
Interview Questions:
1.You are at a college fair and a parent who is an alum comes up to you. He is mad that Col. Reb is no longer the mascot and says he refuses to allow his children to attend Ole Miss until the Col. is back on the field. What do you say?
2. What do you tell a prospective student who wants to major in something Ole Miss does not offer?
3. What's more important, style or substance?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very simple. Met with the administrative coordinator and she asked me a few questions. I heard a reply within a week of the interview. The overall experience was great, enjoyed the job, was sad I had to leave, but was happy to graduate!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Filled out paperwork and was called in for an interview. Was asked standard questions. No surprises. The interview was based on previous training and experience. The interview went well and I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was done very professionally, and I have no complaints.  I was kept in the know the entire time afterward.  I was really a typical interview for a faculty position in a research 1 institution.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was barely any interview. You just submit a few forms and talk to whatever department is hiring. The forms mainly are to help you set up direct deposit, taxes, etc. My actual interview was quick and painless. They mainly just asked about myself and my previous work history. There were no unusual questions and the interviewer seemed to just want to make sure I was the same person as I had put on my application.
Interview Questions: What is your previous work experience?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (Oxford, MS) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I called in asking for a job as a student. They asked for my resume. After I sent it in, i met with my boss and was hired on the spot. It ended up turning into a four year long job. They are always looking for help from good students.
Interview Questions: They asked me my year?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Mississippi (University, MS) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The department hires very less graduate students each semester. Usually acceptance rate is high in the Fall semester. There is no such interview process other than submitting our academic certificates and CV and statement of purpose to the graduate school as well as to the department. They screen out you from several applicants and let you know whether you got the admission or not.
Interview Questions: Why only this university?
